content:
Hello,
I was wondering if anyone has tried to mount logs file path to volumes on docker-compose.yml.
(I am using zilup container)
Also, has anyone configured SSO successfully?
Thank you so much. :)
@jcheng there are definitely a number of folks using SSO; if you're doing SAML/LDAP you'll usually want to use manual configuration.
I don't think there should be any problem mounting a volume for logs.

Tim Abbott said:

jcheng there are definitely a number of folks using SSO; if you're doing SAML/LDAP you'll usually want to use manual configuration.

Hi Tim,
Thank you so much for taking the time to reply to my message again. Really appreciate.
So how will I able to mount log file path to volumes on docker-compose.yml file?
I don't see to find any example online.
Also, I am thinking to let zulip connect to our own authentication system here. Is that possible?
If it does, is there any documents on this configuration?
Thank you so much for your help again. :)

Tim Abbott said:

jcheng https://github.com/zulip/docker-zulip#manual-configuration

Hi Tim,
Thanks again.
If I want to use our own university's SSO, I know I need to use ZulipRemoteUserBackend.
But how about the configuration for ZulipRemoteUserBackend?
Do I need to have extra lines for that type of configuration?
Thank you so much. :)
@jcheng yes, if you read that closely, you'll see you just provide a settings.py file.

Tim Abbott said:

jcheng yes, if you read that closely, you'll see you just provide a settings.py file.

I see. If I don't want to set Maunal_configuration: true. I will have to add extra lines to docker-compose.yml file.
So how about set log files path to volumes. I don't seem to find any examples online.
Do you know where I can find those information?
Thank you. :)
